metadata.name: Content Processing Solution Accelerator
metadata.description:
This module contains the resources required to deploy the [Content Processing solution accelerator](https://github.com/microsoft/content-processing-solution-accelerator) for both Sandbox environments and WAF aligned environments.
> **Note:** This module is not intended for broad, generic use, as it was designed by the Commercial Solution Areas CTO team, as a Microsoft Solution Accelerator. Feature requests and bug fix requests are welcome if they support the needs of this organization but may not be incorporated if they aim to make this module more generic than what it needs to be for its primary use case. This module will likely be updated to leverage AVM resource modules in the future. This may result in breaking changes in upcoming versions when these features are implemented.
Required. Name of the environment to deploy the solution into.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Required. Location for the content understanding service: WestUS | SwedenCentral | AustraliaEast.
Optional. Type of GPT deployment to use: Standard | GlobalStandard.
Optional. Name of the GPT model to deploy: gpt-4o-mini | gpt-4o | gpt-4.
Optional. Version of the GPT model to deploy:.
Required. Capacity of the GPT deployment: (minimum 10).
Optional. Location used for Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Container App deployment.
Optional. The resource group location.
Optional. The resource name format string.
Optional. Enable WAF for the deployment.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Tags to be applied to the resources.
Optional. Set to true to use local build for container app images, otherwise use container registry images.
Optional. Enable scaling for the container apps. Defaults to false.
Optional. The public container image endpoint.
Optional. The Container Image Name to deploy on the Web Container App.
Optional. The Container Image Tag to deploy on the Web Container App.
Optional. The Container Image Name to deploy on the App Container App.
Optional. The Container Image Tag to deploy on the backend.
Optional. The Container Image Name to deploy on the Api Container App.
Optional. The Container Image Tag to deploy on the backend.
Optional. A unique deployment timestamp for solution prefix generation.

metadata.name: Network Security Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Network security Group (NSG).
Required. The name of the security rule.
Required. Whether network traffic is allowed or denied.
Optional. The description of the security rule.

Optional. Optional. The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as "VirtualNetwork", "AzureLoadBalancer" and "Internet" can also be used.
Optional. The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
Optional. The resource IDs of the application security groups specified as destination.
Optional. The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all ports.
Optional. The destination port ranges.
Required. The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

Required. Required. The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Required. Network protocol this rule applies to.

Optional. The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as "VirtualNetwork", "AzureLoadBalancer" and "Internet" can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
Optional. The CIDR or source IP ranges.
Optional. The resource IDs of the application security groups specified as source.
Optional. The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk "*" can also be used to match all ports.
Optional. The source port ranges.
Required. The properties of the security rule.
The type of a security rule.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if only logs are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Name of the Network Security Group.
Optional. Location for all resources.
Optional. Array of Security Rules to deploy to the Network Security Group. When not provided, an NSG including only the built-in roles will be deployed.

Optional. When enabled, flows created from Network Security Group connections will be re-evaluated when rules are updates. Initial enablement will trigger re-evaluation. Network Security Group connection flushing is not available in all regions.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the NSG resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Virtual Networks
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. The Name of VNET Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be peer-localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. Do not verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Optional. Deploy the outbound and the inbound peering.
Optional. The name of the VNET Peering resource in the remove Virtual Network. If not provided, default value will be peer-remoteVnetName-localVnetName.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. Do not verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
Required. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The address prefix for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefixes` is empty.
Conditional. List of address prefixes for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefix` is empty.
Required. The Resource ID of the IPAM pool.
Required. The Resource ID of the IPAM pool.
Required. Number of IP addresses allocated from the pool.
Conditional. The address space for the subnet, deployed from IPAM Pool. Required if `addressPrefixes` and `addressPrefix` is empty and the VNet address space configured to use IPAM Pool.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. The delegation to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.

Optional. Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.

Optional. Set this property to Tenant to allow sharing subnet with other subscriptions in your AAD tenant. This property can only be set if defaultOutboundAccess is set to false, both properties can only be set if subnet is empty.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.
An AVM-aligned type for a diagnostic setting. To be used if both logs & metrics are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The name of the Virtual Network (vNet).
Optional. Location for all resources.

Required. An Array of 1 or more IP Address Prefixes OR the resource ID of the IPAM pool to be used for the Virtual Network. When specifying an IPAM pool resource ID you must also set a value for the parameter called `ipamPoolNumberOfIpAddresses`.
Optional. Number of IP addresses allocated from the pool. To be used only when the addressPrefix param is defined with a resource ID of an IPAM pool.
Optional. The BGP community associated with the virtual network.
Optional. An Array of subnets to deploy to the Virtual Network.
Optional. DNS Servers associated to the Virtual Network.

Optional. Resource ID of the DDoS protection plan to assign the VNET to. If it's left blank, DDoS protection will not be configured. If it's provided, the VNET created by this template will be attached to the referenced DDoS protection plan. The DDoS protection plan can exist in the same or in a different subscription.
Optional. Virtual Network Peering configurations.

Optional. Indicates if encryption is enabled on virtual network and if VM without encryption is allowed in encrypted VNet. Requires the EnableVNetEncryption feature to be registered for the subscription and a supported region to use this property.
Optional. If the encrypted VNet allows VM that does not support encryption. Can only be used when vnetEncryption is enabled.

Optional. The flow timeout in minutes for the Virtual Network, which is used to enable connection tracking for intra-VM flows. Possible values are between 4 and 30 minutes. Default value 0 will set the property to null.
Optional. The diagnostic settings of the service.
Optional. The lock settings of the service.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
Optional. Indicates if VM protection is enabled for all the subnets in the virtual network.

properties.addressSpace: [if(contains(parameters('addressPrefixes')[0], '/Microsoft.Network/networkManagers/'), createObject('ipamPoolPrefixAllocations', createArray(createObject('pool', createObject('id', parameters('addressPrefixes')[0]), 'numberOfIpAddresses', parameters('ipamPoolNumberOfIpAddresses')))), createObject('addressPrefixes', parameters('addressPrefixes')))]

properties.notes: [if(equals(tryGet(parameters('lock'), 'kind'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot delete or modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Virtual Network Subnets
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Subnet.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Required. The principal ID of the principal (user/group/identity) to assign the role to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. The Name of the subnet resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent virtual network. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Conditional. The address prefix for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefixes` is empty.
Conditional. The address space for the subnet, deployed from IPAM Pool. Required if `addressPrefixes` and `addressPrefix` is empty.
Optional. The resource ID of the network security group to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the route table to assign to the subnet.
Optional. The service endpoints to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The delegation to enable on the subnet.
Optional. The resource ID of the NAT Gateway to use for the subnet.
Optional. Enable or disable apply network policies on private endpoint in the subnet.
Optional. Enable or disable apply network policies on private link service in the subnet.
Conditional. List of address prefixes for the subnet. Required if `addressPrefix` is empty.

Optional. Set this property to false to disable default outbound connectivity for all VMs in the subnet. This property can only be set at the time of subnet creation and cannot be updated for an existing subnet.

Optional. Set this property to Tenant to allow sharing the subnet with other subscriptions in your AAD tenant. This property can only be set if defaultOutboundAccess is set to false, both properties can only be set if the subnet is empty.
Optional. Application gateway IP configurations of virtual network resource.
Optional. An array of service endpoint policies.
Optional. Array of role assignments to create.
Optional. Enable/Disable usage telemetry for module.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.
The address prefix for the subnet.
List of address prefixes for the subnet.
The IPAM pool prefix allocations for the subnet.

metadata.name: Virtual Network Peerings
metadata.description: This module deploys a Virtual Network Peering.
Optional. The Name of VNET Peering resource. If not provided, default value will be localVnetName-remoteVnetName.
Conditional. The name of the parent Virtual Network to add the peering to. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The Resource ID of the VNet that is this Local VNet is being peered to. Should be in the format of a Resource ID.
Optional. Whether the forwarded traffic from the VMs in the local virtual network will be allowed/disallowed in remote virtual network. Default is true.
Optional. If gateway links can be used in remote virtual networking to link to this virtual network. Default is false.
Optional. Whether the VMs in the local virtual network space would be able to access the VMs in remote virtual network space. Default is true.
Optional. If we need to verify the provisioning state of the remote gateway. Default is true.

Optional. If remote gateways can be used on this virtual network. If the flag is set to true, and allowGatewayTransit on remote peering is also true, virtual network will use gateways of remote virtual network for transit. Only one peering can have this flag set to true. This flag cannot be set if virtual network already has a gateway. Default is false.
The resource group the virtual network peering was deployed into.
The name of the virtual network peering.
The resource ID of the virtual network peering.

The resource group the virtual network was deployed into.

The name of the virtual network.
The names of the deployed subnets.
The resource IDs of the deployed subnets.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Log Analytics Workspaces
metadata.description: This module deploys a Log Analytics Workspace.
Optional. The name of diagnostic setting.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set the specific logs to collect here.
Optional. Name of a Diagnostic Log category group for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `allLogs` to collect all logs.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed. "allLogs" includes all possible logs for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable log collection.
Required. Name of a Diagnostic Metric category for a resource type this setting is applied to. Set to `AllMetrics` to collect all metrics.
Optional. Enable or disable the category explicitly. Default is `true`.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed. "allMetrics" includes all possible metrics for the resource. Set to `[]` to disable metric collection.
Optional. A string indicating whether the export to Log Analytics should use the default destination type, i.e. AzureDiagnostics, or use a destination type.
Optional. Instead of using an external reference, use the deployed instance as the target for its diagnostic settings. If set to `true`, the `workspaceResourceId` property is ignored.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. The full ARM resource ID of the Marketplace resource to which you would like to send Diagnostic Logs.

Required. Name of the solution.
For solutions authored by Microsoft, the name must be in the pattern: `SolutionType(WorkspaceName)`, for example: `AntiMalware(contoso-Logs)`.
For solutions authored by third parties, the name should be in the pattern: `SolutionType[WorkspaceName]`, for example `MySolution[contoso-Logs]`.
The solution type is case-sensitive.
Required. Plan for solution object supported by the OperationsManagement resource provider.

Optional. The resource id of the resource that will be linked to the workspace. This should be used for linking resources which require write access.

Required. The list of audiences that can appear in the issued token. Should be set to api://AzureADTokenExchange for Azure AD. It says what Microsoft identity platform should accept in the aud claim in the incoming token. This value represents Azure AD in your external identity provider and has no fixed value across identity providers - you might need to create a new application registration in your IdP to serve as the audience of this token.

Like the audience value, it has no fixed format, as each IdP uses their own - sometimes a GUID, sometimes a colon delimited identifier, sometimes arbitrary strings. The value here must match the sub claim within the token presented to Azure AD.

Optional. This property can only be changed for unlocked time-based retention policies. When enabled, new blocks can be written to an append blob while maintaining immutability protection and compliance. Only new blocks can be added and any existing blocks cannot be modified or deleted. This property cannot be changed with ExtendImmutabilityPolicy API.

Optional. This property can only be changed for unlocked time-based retention policies. When enabled, new blocks can be written to both "Append and Block Blobs" while maintaining immutability protection and compliance. Only new blocks can be added and any existing blocks cannot be modified or deleted. This property cannot be changed with ExtendImmutabilityPolicy API. The "allowProtectedAppendWrites" and "allowProtectedAppendWritesAll" properties are mutually exclusive.

metadata.name: User Assigned Identity Federated Identity Credential
metadata.description: This module deploys a User Assigned Identity Federated Identity Credential.
Conditional. The name of the parent user assigned identity. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the secret.

Required. The list of audiences that can appear in the issued token. Should be set to api://AzureADTokenExchange for Azure AD. It says what Microsoft identity platform should accept in the aud claim in the incoming token. This value represents Azure AD in your external identity provider and has no fixed value across identity providers - you might need to create a new application registration in your IdP to serve as the audience of this token.
Required. The URL of the issuer to be trusted. Must match the issuer claim of the external token being exchanged.

Required. The identifier of the external software workload within the external identity provider. Like the audience value, it has no fixed format, as each IdP uses their own - sometimes a GUID, sometimes a colon delimited identifier, sometimes arbitrary strings. The value here must match the sub claim within the token presented to Azure AD.

The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod's terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). Conditional. The name of the parent Container App. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.

Optional. The configuration settings of the HTTP requests for authentication and authorization requests made against ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.

metadata.name: Container Apps
metadata.description: This module deploys a Container App.
Optional. Container start command arguments.
Optional. Container start command.
Optional. Container environment variables.
Required. Container image tag.
Optional. Custom container name.
Optional. List of probes for the container.
Required. Container resource requirements.
Optional. Container volume mounts.
The type for a container.
Optional. Specifies the exposed port for the target port. If not specified, it defaults to target port.
Required. Specifies whether the app port is accessible outside of the environment.
Required. Specifies the port the container listens on.
The type for an ingress port mapping.
Required. The name of the service.
Required. The service ID.
The type for a service binding.
Required. Environment variable name.
Optional. Name of the Container App secret from which to pull the environment variable value.
Optional. Non-secret environment variable value.
The type for an environment variable.
Optional. Minimum consecutive failures for the probe to be considered failed after having succeeded. Defaults to 3.
Optional. HTTPGet specifies the http request to perform.
Optional. Number of seconds after the container has started before liveness probes are initiated.
Optional. How often (in seconds) to perform the probe. Default to 10 seconds.
Optional. Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed. Defaults to 1. Must be 1 for liveness and startup.
Optional. The TCP socket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported.

Optional. Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully upon probe failure. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process. If this value is nil, the pod's terminationGracePeriodSeconds will be used. Otherwise, this value overrides the value provided by the pod spec. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates stop immediately via the kill signal (no opportunity to shut down). This is an alpha field and requires enabling ProbeTerminationGracePeriod feature gate. Maximum value is 3600 seconds (1 hour).
Optional. Number of seconds after which the probe times out. Defaults to 1 second.
Optional. The type of probe.
The type for a container app probe.
Optional. Switch to determine whether the resource allows credentials.
Optional. Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-headers header.
Optional. Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-methods header.
Optional. Specifies the content for the access-control-allow-origins header.
Optional. Specifies the content for the access-control-expose-headers header.
Optional. Specifies the content for the access-control-max-age header.
The type for a CORS policy.
Optional. Host name to connect to. Defaults to the pod IP.
Optional. HTTP headers to set in the request.
Required. Path to access on the HTTP server.
Required. Name or number of the port to access on the container.
Optional. Scheme to use for connecting to the host. Defaults to HTTP.
The type for a container app probe HTTP GET.
Required. Name of the header.
Required. Value of the header.
The type for a container app probe HTTP GET header.
Optional. Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP.
Required. Number of the port to access on the container. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.
The type for a container app probe TCP socket.
Required. The maximum number of replicas.
Required. The minimum number of replicas.
Optional. The cooldown period in seconds.
Optional. The polling interval in seconds.
Optional. The scaling rules.
The scale settings for the Container App.
Required. The name of the scaling rule.
Optional. The custom scaling rule.
Optional. The Azure Queue based scaling rule.
Optional. The HTTP requests based scaling rule.
Optional. The TCP based scaling rule.
The scaling rules for the Container App.
Required. Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted.Must not contain ':'.
Optional. Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Defaults to "" (volume's root).
Required. This must match the Name of a Volume.
The type for a volume mount.
Optional. Resource ID of a managed identity to authenticate with Azure Key Vault, or System to use a system-assigned identity.
Conditional. The URL of the Azure Key Vault secret referenced by the Container App. Required if `value` is null.
Optional. The name of the container app secret.
Conditional. The container app secret value, if not fetched from the Key Vault. Required if `keyVaultUrl` is not null.
The type for a secret.
Optional. The configuration settings of the secrets references of encryption key and signing key for ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings that determines the validation flow of users using Service Authentication and/or Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of the HTTP requests for authentication and authorization requests made against ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of each of the identity providers used to configure ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of the login flow of users using ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
Optional. The configuration settings of the platform of ContainerApp Service Authentication/Authorization.
The type for the container app's authentication configuration.
Optional. Specify the name of lock.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
An AVM-aligned type for a lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The resource ID(s) to assign to the resource. Required if a user assigned identity is used for encryption.
An AVM-aligned type for a managed identity configuration. To be used if both a system-assigned & user-assigned identities are supported by the resource provider.
Optional. The name (as GUID) of the role assignment. If not provided, a GUID will be generated.

Required. The role to assign. You can provide either the display name of the role definition, the role definition GUID, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.

Optional. The Resource Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
An AVM-aligned type for a role assignment.
Required. Name of the Container App.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Bool to disable all ingress traffic for the container app.
Optional. Bool indicating if the App exposes an external HTTP endpoint.

Optional. Bool indicating if the Container App should enable session affinity.
